item.title: Dev K8s Options
item.description: Minikube, KinD (Kubernetes in Docker), and k3d (K3s in Docker) are all tools for running Kubernetes clusters locally, primarily for development purposes. My personal experience with all 3 has been very positive. For the last couple of years I’ve been operating on Fedora linux and have been keeping up with the latest releases. Originally I used minikube, but switched over to k3d whe DNS issues prevented it from reaching docker hub.
